channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Pop-up campsite rules 'harming communities'
item.description: Some living near beauty spots say they are dealing with dangerous traffic and fire pits burning all night.

item.title: Family fight to stop Vale's Model Farm becoming business park
item.description: The Jenkins family have been told to go by next July as a financial services firm wants to build there.

item.title: Covid: Safety fears as face-mask rules 'ignored on Welsh trains'
item.description: Some passengers say they feel unsafe, crammed on trains face-to-face with people not wearing masks.

item.title: Logan Mwangi: Community remembers boy, 5, found dead in river
item.description: Neighbours and friends gather to remember the "happy-go-lucky" child who died in Bridgend.

item.title: Cheers Drive: Name plea for Cardiff bus station road
item.description: Could the well-known south Wales phrase become a real road in praise of Cardiff's bus drivers?

item.title: Boy takes on 150-mile walk from Rugby to visit grandparents
item.description: Fundraising Arthur Mortimer says he is looking forward to his nan's cakes after lockdown kept them apart.

item.title: Bridgend: Tribute to boy, 2, as woman arrested for murder
item.description: Reid Steele died in hospital after being found in a critical condition at a house in Bridgend.

item.title: Humpback whale spotted off Pembrokeshire coast
item.description: Tour guide Ffion Rees says it is the first time she had seen the species in UK waters in 27 years.

item.title: Two boys arrested after Cardiff football field attack
item.description: The 15-year-old victim suffered a puncture wound to his leg in the assault, police say.

item.title: Covid study: How to avoid catching virus in a shared car
item.description: Opening four windows at lower speeds and only two on the motorway is best, researchers say.

item.title: Anglesey: Rescued woman 'very fortunate' to be alive
item.description: Wendy Goddard got into trouble after drifting out to sea on an inflatable on Friday.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Rail staff face abuse enforcing mask rules
item.description: Passengers on trains in Wales must still wear a mask, unlike in England where it is only advised.

item.title: Covid-19: How many windows to keep open to cut virus build-up
item.description: Opening four windows at lower speeds and only two on the motorway is best, researchers say.

item.title: Reading: Teacher gets stories published after 46 years
item.description: Keith Godwin used to make up stories for his pupils in the 1970s, now they have been published.

item.title: Covid: Record north Wales visitors after 'challenging' 18 months
item.description: North Wales has experienced a record-breaking summer for visitors, a tourism association says.

item.title: GCSEs: Wales' pupils celebrate as A and A* grades improve again
item.description: A and A* grades made up 28.7% of those awarded, compared with 18.4% when exams were last held in 2019.

item.title: Abercynon Road: Man charged after car crashed into vehicles
item.description: A man, charged with drink driving, will appear before magistrates after several cars were damaged.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Defending table tennis champion Rob Davies ruled out through injury
item.description: Paralympic table tennis champion Rob Davies will not defend his title at Tokyo 2020 after being ruled out of the Games through injury.

item.title: Swansea City 0-0 Sheffield United: Points shared as new bosses get off the mark
item.description: Russell Martin and Slavisa Jokanovic get off the mark at their respective new clubs thanks to a goalless draw between Swansea City and Sheffield United.

item.title: Blackpool 0-2 Cardiff City: Bluebirds dominate Tangerines
item.description: A dominant display by Cardiff City sees them earn a 2-0 win at Bloomfield Road against newly-promoted Blackpool.

item.title: Alaves 1-4 Real Madrid: Karim Benzema scores twice as Real win on opening day
item.description: Karim Benzema scores twice as Real Madrid beat Alaves in their La Liga opener as Carlo Ancelotti and Gareth Bale return to the club.

item.title: Joe Cordina defeats Henrandez to extend unbeaten record
item.description: Welsh boxer Joe Cordina secures a stunning victory over American Joshuah Hernandez via a first-round knockout

item.title: Charli Britton, drymiwr Edward H. Dafis, wedi marw
item.description: Mae drymiwr y band Edward H. Dafis, Charli Britton, wedi marw'n 68 oed.

item.title: Gwersyllfaoedd dros dro yn niweidio cymunedau gwledig
item.description: Trigolion mannau prydferth yn gorfod dygymod â thraffig peryglus a thyllau tân yn llosgi drwy'r nos.

item.title: 'Fi wedi bod mewn lockdown ers 20 mlynedd'
item.description: Mae Rhys Bowler yn galw am gyllid iechyd personol er mwyn rhoi mwy o ryddid i bobl fel fe sy'n byw ag anabledd.

item.title: Y Bencampwriaeth: Abertawe 0-0 Sheffield United
item.description: Gêm ddi-sgôr oedd hi rhwng Abertawe a Sheffield United nos Sadwrn yn ne Cymru.
